Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: dapr

Arguments.Name: --runtime-path
Arguments.Description: The path to the dapr runtime installation directory

Arguments.Name: annotate
Arguments.Description: Add dapr annotations to a Kubernetes configuration. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --api-token-secret
Arguments.Description: The secret to use for the API token

Arguments.Name: --app-max-concurrency
Arguments.Description: The maximum number of concurrent requests to allow

Arguments.Name: --app-port
Arguments.Description: The port to expose the app on

Arguments.Name: --app-protocol
Arguments.Description: The protocol to use for the app. Allowed values http, https, h2c, grpc, grpcs

Arguments.Name: --app-token-secret
Arguments.Description: The secret to use for the app token

Arguments.Name: --dapr-image
Arguments.Description: The image to use for the dapr sidecar container

Arguments.Name: --disable-builtin-k8s-secret-store
Arguments.Description: Disable the built-in k8s secret store

Arguments.Name: --enable-api-logging
Arguments.Description: Enable API logging for the Dapr sidecar

Arguments.Name: --env
Arguments.Description: Environment variables to set (key value pairs, comma separated)

Arguments.Name: --graceful-shutdown-seconds
Arguments.Description: The number of seconds to wait for the app to shutdown

Arguments.Name: --http-read-buffer-size
Arguments.Description: The maximum size of HTTP header read buffer in kilobytes

Arguments.Name: --http-stream-request-body
Arguments.Description: Enable streaming request body for HTTP

Arguments.Name: --liveness-probe-delay
Arguments.Description: The delay to use for the liveness probe

Arguments.Name: --liveness-probe-period
Arguments.Description: The period to use for the liveness probe

Arguments.Name: --liveness-probe-threshold
Arguments.Description: The threshold to use for the liveness probe

Arguments.Name: --liveness-probe-timeout
Arguments.Description: The timeout to use for the liveness probe

Arguments.Name: --max-request-body-size
Arguments.Description: The maximum request body size to use

Arguments.Name: --metrics-port
Arguments.Description: The port to expose the metrics on

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: The namespace the resource target is in (can only be set if --resource is also set)

Arguments.Name: --placement-host-address
Arguments.Description: Comma separated list of addresses for Dapr actor placement servers

Arguments.Name: --readiness-probe-delay
Arguments.Description: The delay to use for the readiness probe

Arguments.Name: --readiness-probe-period
Arguments.Description: The period to use for the readiness probe

Arguments.Name: --readiness-probe-threshold
Arguments.Description: The threshold to use for the readiness probe

Arguments.Name: --readiness-probe-timeout
Arguments.Description: The timeout to use for the readiness probe

Arguments.Name: --resource
Arguments.Description: The resource to target to annotate

Arguments.Name: --unix-domain-socket-path
Arguments.Description: Linux domain socket path to use for communicating with the Dapr sidecar

Arguments.Name: --volume-mounts
Arguments.Description: List of pod volumes to be mounted to the sidecar container in read-only mode

Arguments.Name: --volume-mounts-rw
Arguments.Description: List of pod volumes to be mounted to the sidecar container in read-write mode

Arguments.Name: build-info
Arguments.Description: Print build info of Dapr CLI and runtime

Arguments.Name: components
Arguments.Description: List all Dapr components. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --all-namespaces
Arguments.Description: If true, list all Dapr components in all namespaces

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: List all Dapr components in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: The components name to be printed (optional)

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: List all namespace components in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format (options: json or yaml or list)

Arguments.Name: configurations
Arguments.Description: List all Dapr configurations. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --all-namespaces
Arguments.Description: If true, list all Dapr configurations in all namespaces

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: List all Dapr configurations in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: The configuration name to be printed (optional)

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: List Define namespace configurations in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Output format (options: json or yaml or list)

Arguments.Name: dashboard
Arguments.Description: Start Dapr dashboard. Supported platforms: Kubernetes and self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --address
Arguments.Description: Address to listen on. Only accepts IP address or localhost as a value

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Opens Dapr dashboard in local browser via local proxy to Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: The namespace where Dapr dashboard is running

Arguments.Name: --port
Arguments.Description: The local port on which to serve Dapr dashboard

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Print the version for Dapr dashboard

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Install Dapr on supported hosting platforms. Supported platforms: Kubernetes and self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --container-runtime
Arguments.Description: The container runtime to use. Supported values are docker (default) and podman

Arguments.Name: --dashboard-version
Arguments.Description: The version of the Dapr dashboard to install, for example: 0.13.0

Arguments.Name: --dev
Arguments.Description: Use Dev mode. Deploy Redis, Zipkin also in the Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --from-dir
Arguments.Description: Use Dapr artifacts from local directory for self-hosted installation

Arguments.Name: --image-variant
Arguments.Description: The image variant to use for the Dapr runtime, for example: mariner

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Deploy Dapr to a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: The Kubernetes namespace to install Dapr in

Arguments.Name: --network
Arguments.Description: The Docker network on which to deploy the Dapr runtime

Arguments.Name: --runtime-version
Arguments.Description: The version of the Dapr runtime to install, for example: 1.0.0

Arguments.Name: --set
Arguments.Description: Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2)

Arguments.Name: --slim
Arguments.Description: Exclude placement service, Redis and Zipkin containers from self-hosted installation

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: The wait timeout for the Kubernetes installation

Arguments.Name: --wait
Arguments.Description: Wait for Kubernetes initialization to complete

Arguments.Name: invoke
Arguments.Description: Invoke a method on a given Dapr application. Supported platforms: Self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --data-file
Arguments.Description: A file containing the JSON serialized data (optional)

Arguments.Name: --unix-domain-socket
Arguments.Description: Path to a unix domain socket dir. If specified, Dapr API servers will use Unix Domain Sockets

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all Dapr instances. Supported platforms: Kubernetes and self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --all-namespaces
Arguments.Description: If true, list all Dapr pods in all namespaces

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: List all Dapr pods in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: List define namespace pod in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: The output format of the list. Valid values are: json, yaml, or table (default)

Arguments.Name: logs
Arguments.Description: Get Dapr sidecar logs for an application. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --app-id
Arguments.Description: The application id for which logs are needed

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Get logs from a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: The Kubernetes namespace in which your application is deployed

Arguments.Name: --pod-name
Arguments.Description: The name of the pod in Kubernetes, in case your application has multiple pods (optional)

Arguments.Name: mtls
Arguments.Description: Check if mTLS is enabled. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Check if mTLS is enabled in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: expiry
Arguments.Description: Checks the expiry of the root certificate

Arguments.Name: export
Arguments.Description: Export the root CA, issuer cert and key from Kubernetes to local files

Arguments.Name: --out
Arguments.Description: The output directory path to save the certs

Arguments.Name: renew-cert
Arguments.Description: Rotates the Dapr root certificate on your Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --image-variant
Arguments.Description: The image variant to use for the Dapr runtime, for example: mariner

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Renews root and issuer certificates of Dapr in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --private-key
Arguments.Description: The root.key file which is used to generate root certificate

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: The timeout for the certificate renewal

Arguments.Name: publish
Arguments.Description: Publish a pub-sub event. Supported platforms: Self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --data-file
Arguments.Description: A file containing the JSON serialized data (optional)

Arguments.Name: --publish-app-id
Arguments.Description: The ID of the publishing app

Arguments.Name: --pubsub
Arguments.Description: The name of the pub/sub component

Arguments.Name: --topic
Arguments.Description: The topic to be published to

Arguments.Name: --unix-domain-socket
Arguments.Description: Path to a unix domain socket dir. If specified, Dapr API servers will use Unix Domain Sockets

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Run Dapr and (optionally) your application side by side. Supported platforms: Self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --app-channel-address
Arguments.Description: The network address the application listens on

Arguments.Name: --app-health-check-path
Arguments.Description: Path used for health checks; HTTP only

Arguments.Name: --app-health-probe-interval
Arguments.Description: Interval to probe for the health of the app in seconds

Arguments.Name: --app-health-probe-timeout
Arguments.Description: Timeout for app health probes in milliseconds

Arguments.Name: --app-health-threshold
Arguments.Description: Number of consecutive failures for the app to be considered unhealthy

Arguments.Name: --app-id
Arguments.Description: The id for your application, used for service discovery

Arguments.Name: --app-max-concurrency
Arguments.Description: The concurrency level of the application, otherwise is unlimited

Arguments.Name: --app-port
Arguments.Description: The port your application is listening on

Arguments.Name: --app-protocol
Arguments.Description: The protocol (grpc, grpcs, http, https, h2c) Dapr uses to talk to the application

Arguments.Name: --app-ssl
Arguments.Description: Enable https when Dapr invokes the application

Arguments.Name: --components-path
Arguments.Description: The path for components directory. Default is $HOME/.dapr/components or %USERPROFILE%.daprcomponents

Arguments.Name: --dapr-grpc-port
Arguments.Description: The gRPC port for Dapr to listen on

Arguments.Name: --dapr-http-max-request-size
Arguments.Description: Max size of request body in MB

Arguments.Name: --dapr-http-port
Arguments.Description: The HTTP port for Dapr to listen on

Arguments.Name: --dapr-http-read-buffer-size
Arguments.Description: HTTP header read buffer in KB

Arguments.Name: --dapr-internal-grpc-port
Arguments.Description: The gRPC port for the Dapr internal API to listen on

Arguments.Name: --dapr-listen-addresses
Arguments.Description: Comma separated list of IP addresses that sidecar will listen to

Arguments.Name: --enable-api-logging
Arguments.Description: Log API calls at INFO verbosity. Valid values are: true or false

Arguments.Name: --enable-app-health-check
Arguments.Description: Enable health checks for the application using the protocol defined with app-protocol

Arguments.Name: --enable-profiling
Arguments.Description: Enable pprof profiling via an HTTP endpoint

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Run the multi-app run template against Kubernetes environment

Arguments.Name: --log-level
Arguments.Description: The log verbosity. Valid values are: debug, info, warn, error, fatal, or panic

Arguments.Name: --metrics-port
Arguments.Description: The port of metrics on dapr

Arguments.Name: --placement-host-address
Arguments.Description: The address of the placement service. Format is either <hostname> for default port or <hostname>:<port> for custom port

Arguments.Name: --profile-port
Arguments.Description: The port for the profile server to listen on

Arguments.Name: --run-file
Arguments.Description: Path to the run template file for the list of apps to run

Arguments.Name: --unix-domain-socket
Arguments.Description: Path to a unix domain socket dir. If specified, Dapr API servers will use Unix Domain Sockets

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Show the health status of Dapr services. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Show the health status of Dapr services on Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: stop
Arguments.Description: Stop Dapr instances and their associated apps. Supported platforms: Self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --app-id
Arguments.Description: The application id to be stopped

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Stop deployments in Kunernetes based on multi-app run file

Arguments.Name: --run-file
Arguments.Description: Path to the run template file for the list of apps to stop

Arguments.Name: uninstall
Arguments.Description: Uninstall Dapr runtime. Supported platforms: Kubernetes and self-hosted

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Remove .dapr directory, Redis, Placement and Zipkin containers on local machine, and CRDs on a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --container-runtime
Arguments.Description: The container runtime to use. Supported values are docker (default) and podman

Arguments.Name: --dev
Arguments.Description: Uninstall Dapr Redis and Zipking installations from Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Uninstall Dapr from a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: The Kubernetes namespace to uninstall Dapr from

Arguments.Name: --network
Arguments.Description: The Docker network from which to remove the Dapr runtime

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: The timeout for the Kubernetes uninstall

Arguments.Name: upgrade
Arguments.Description: Upgrades or downgrades a Dapr control plane installation in a cluster. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Name: --dashboard-version
Arguments.Description: The version of the Dapr dashboard to upgrade or downgrade to, for example: 0.13.0

Arguments.Name: --image-variant
Arguments.Description: The image variant to use for the Dapr runtime, for example: mariner

Arguments.Name: --kubernetes
Arguments.Description: Upgrade or downgrade Dapr in a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --runtime-version
Arguments.Description: The version of the Dapr runtime to upgrade or downgrade to, for example: 1.0.0

Arguments.Name: --set
Arguments.Description: Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2)

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: The timeout for the Kubernetes upgrade

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Print the Dapr runtime and CLI version

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: The output format of the version command. Valid values are: json

Arguments.Description: Add dapr annotations to a Kubernetes configuration. Supported platforms: Kubernetes

Arguments.Description: Print build info of Dapr CLI and runtime
